newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Peso drop seen benefiting Philex.
newsitem.headline: Peso drop seen benefiting Philex.

text.p: Philex Mining Corp said on Wednesday it expected to benefit from the drop of the peso against the dollar.
Philex estimates that for every one peso drop in the exchange rate, over 150 million pesos will be added to its revenues per year as all production is being exported," the firm said in a statement.
The peso has fallen more than nine percent against the dollar since July 11 when the Central Bank released its grip on the currency in the face of relentless speculative attacks.
The peso ended at 29 on Wednesday against 26.40 before its de-facto devaluation two weeks ago.
The firm said higher revenues due to the drop in the peso would offset unrealised income from the drop in gold prices in the world market.
Gold prices tumbled to a 12-year low early this month to US$314 an ounce. It was quoted at $325.40/90 per ounce at midday on Wednesday in Hong Kong.

Brimo said some 67,000 ounces of the production of its subsidiary Philex Gold Inc has been fixed at $352 per ounce, and the price of another 64,000 ounces of its 1998 output has been fixed at $348 per ounce.
Also, the price of some 54,000 ounces of gold from Philex Mining's Padcal mine has been fixed at $352 per ounce and 53,000 ounces from its projected 1998 output at $348 per ounce.
